static int R_last_jsr_in_cb ( L_Oper *  jsr  )  [static]

Determines if a jsr is the last one in a CB.

Parameters:
jsr the jsr oper to inspect
Returns:
If jsr is the last jsr in its CB, returns 1. Otherwise, returns 0.

static int R_used_between_jsrs ( int  vreg_id,
L_Oper *  jsr1,
L_Oper *  jsr2 
) [static]

Determines if a register is used between two jsrs.

Parameters:
vreg_id the register's id (L_Operand->value.r, R_Reg->phys_reg)
jsr1 the first jsr
jsr2 the second jsr
Returns:
If any opers between jsr1 and jsr2 use register vreg_id, returns 1. Otherwise, returns 0.
This function is used to try to conservatively spill and fill registers between jsrs. If a register is not used between two jsrs, there's no reason to fill it after the first and spill it before the second. This is particularly important in C++, where almost every operation is a jsr (See bug 323).

Added 11/29/04 REK
